svg.title: Rotate an element
svg.desc: This example demonstrate how to rotate an ellipse element by 45 degrees. The rotation is accomplished by adding a "transform" attribute, setting the number of degrees to rotates, and the x,y centerpoint of rotation,

body.p: To rotate an element, add a “transform” attribute to it, then set the attribute to something like “rotate(45 235.5 120.5)”, where the first number is the degrees of rotation, and the next two numbers are x,y values for the center of rotation. macSVG supports interactive rotations and other transforms with the Transform Attribute Editor, which is available when a transform attribute is selected.
